page.title: 10NEW ROADS AROUND IPSWICH
page.content: The opening of the Orwell Bridge in the early 1980's has allowed Ipswich to re-think it's problem of coping with heavy traffic. The bridge allows traffic to by-pass Ipswich, it's adjacent roads are dual carraigeway with frequent parking lay-bys. The surface is tarmacadam and The road has the necessary safety easures such as protective lorries. The roads are designed to have gentle gradients and the sides have been carefully landscaped and fenced. A mid-week,mid-morning traffic count shows: 700 vehicles per hour towards Felixstowe 550 vehicles per hour towards Ipswich. Increased traffic is exspected when other roads are constructed to link up with the by-pass.
